document.heading: Amending Chapter CSV.7 Shoreline Protection Code

recital.text: the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians is a federally recognized Indian tribe ("Tribe") organized pursuant to the provisions of the Indian Reorganization Act of 1934, 25 U.S.C. ยง5101, et seq.; and,

the Tribal Governing Board serves as the governing body of Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians pursuant to Article III, ยง 1 of the Amended Constitution and Bylaws of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians; and

pursuant to Article V, ยง 1(n) of the Amended Constitution and By-laws of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians, the Tribal Governing Board is empowered to "regulate, by enactment of ordinances, the conduct of business within the territory of the band"; and

pursuant to Article V, Section 1 (s) of the Amended Constitution and Bylaws of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians, the Tribal Governing Board possesses certain powers, including: "To promulgate and enforce ordinances governing the conduct of members of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians of Wisconsin and providing for the maintenance of law and order and the administration of justice by establishing a tribal court and defining its duties and powers."; and
the Tribal Governing Board duly enacted the Lac Courte Oreilles Conservation Code to regulate any related activities within the jurisdiction of the Tribe.
the Tribal Governing Board passed Resolution 16-32 establishing the Shoreland Protection Code (CSV.7) under Title CSV Conservation of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Code of Law.
The Tribal Governing Board now wishes to amend CSV.7 to include sections related to the wake of watercraft on waterbodies within the jurisdiction of the Tribe.
that the Tribal Governing Board hereby determines that it is in the best interest of the Tribe to amends CSV.7 to include the following additional sections as are found below.

recital.conjunction: NOW THEREFORE BE IT FINALLY RESOLVED,
recital.text: that the attached amendments to Title CSV.7 of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians of the Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Code of Law, shall be, and hereby is, amended and enacted as an ordinance of the Tribe, pursuant to Article IV, ยง 3 of the Amended Constitution and Bylaws of the Lac Courte Oreilles Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians as follows:

para.text: CSV.7.1.030 Findings of Fact is amended as follows:

include.text: Uncontrolled use of the shorelands and pollution of the navigable waters of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation would adversely affect the public health, safety and general welfare of Lac Courte Oreilles citizens (members). The Lac Courte Oreilles Tribal Governing Board has the responsibility to promote the health, safety, and welfare, of Lac Courte Oreilles citizens (members); to further the maintenance of safe and healthful conditions; prevent and control water pollution; prevent shoreline erosion, protect spawning grounds, fish and aquatic life; control building sites, placement of structures; and to preserve shore cover and natural beauty. This ordinance has been adopted for the purpose of protecting the environment of the Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation.

para.text: CSV.7.1.040 Purpose is amended as follows:

include.text: The purpose of this ordinance is to promote the health, safety, and welfare of Lac Courte Oreilles citizens (members). As such, this ordinance has been established to:

para.text: Further the maintenance of safe and healthful conditions and prevent and control water pollution through:
Controlling filling and grading to prevent serious soil erosion problems.
Protect spawning grounds, fish and aquatic life through:
Preserving wetlands and other fish and aquatic habitat;
Regulating pollution sources;
Controlling shoreline alterations, dredging and lagooning.
Preserve shore cover, natural beauty, and prohibit unnecessary shoreline erosion through:
Restricting the removal of natural shoreland cover;
Preventing shoreline encroachment by structures;
Controlling shoreland excavation and other earth moving activities; and
Regulating the placement of structures.
Prohibiting operation of watercraft to create an artificial wake as is found under CSV.7.5.070 Wake Protection.

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of this ordinance is to promote the health, safety, and welfare of Lac Courte Oreilles citizens (members). As such, this ordinance has been established to:

para.text: Further the maintenance of safe and healthful conditions and prevent and control water pollution through:
Controlling filling and grading to prevent serious soil erosion problems.
Protect spawning grounds, fish and aquatic life through:
Preserving wetlands and other fish and aquatic habitat;
Regulating pollution sources;
Controlling shoreline alterations, dredging and lagooning.
Preserve shore cover, natural beauty, and prohibit unnecessary shoreline erosion through:
Restricting the removal of natural shoreland cover;
Preventing shoreline encroachment by structures;
Controlling shoreland excavation and other earth moving activities; and
Regulating the placement of structures.
Prohibiting operation of watercraft to create an artificial wake as is found under CSV.7.5.070 Wake Protection.
CSV.7.5.070 Wake Protection is enacted as follows:
Prohibited Equipment. No person may use or employ ballast tanks, ballast bags or fins to cause a boat to operate in a bow-high manner, or which increases or enhances a boat's wake.
Prohibited Operation. No person may operate a boat in an artificially bow-high manner having the effect of increasing the boat's wake. Such prohibited operation shall include:
wake in excess of 24 inches above the waterline.
wake enhancement by use of ballast tanks, or ballast bags or fins.

continuous operation at transition speed (the speed below planing speed in which a boat is operating in plowing mode). For the purpose of this provision, "continuous operation" shall mean operation that is not acceleration for the purpose of achieving a state of planing."

In no event shall any of the following operations be deemed a violation of this Ordinance, provided such operations do not create an artificial wake by continuous operation below planning speed, use or employ ballast tanks, ballast bags or wake enhancing fins: i) water skiing, ii) tubing, iii) wake boarding employing a tow rope; iv) brief transition operation to empty a boat of bilge water, or v) brief transition operation of a boat accelerating into a planing condition.
Penalties.

For each instance where an individual or entity violates the restrictions above, the Tribe, acting through its Conservation Department Wardens, or Police Department's Officers, may cite and impose a civil penalty not to exceed five-thousand dollars ($5,000) per violation/occurrence on any person or entity who violates this ordinance.
